identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a trust-focused, professional home services platform that blends Swiss medical cleanliness with Uber-like efficiency.
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix professional trust with home warmth.
Emotion First: Every pixel must convey reliability and safety.
Content is King: Service clarity is paramount.
Zoom In: Focus on the details of the service (hands, tools, results).
Negative Space: Use white space to create a sense of cleanliness.

accent.name: Action Blue
accent.usage: Primary Buttons, Links, Active States, Icons

marketing.hero_style: Split Screen: Left Content, Right Image
rules: Never center text for long paragraphs.
Use 'Manrope' for all headings to establish brand voice.
Maximize data density but keep it readable.
Use 'Inter' for all data tables and metrics.

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-white hover:bg-primary/90 rounded-full px-8 py-6 text-lg font-semibold shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl transition-all
buttons.secondary: bg-white text-primary border border-slate-200 hover:bg-slate-50 rounded-full px-6 py-4 font-medium

cards.marketing: bg-white rounded-2xl border border-slate-100 shadow-card hover:shadow-hover transition-all duration-300 p-8
cards.dashboard: bg-white rounded-xl border border-slate-200 shadow-sm p-6

inputs.default: h-12 rounded-lg border-slate-200 focus:border-accent focus:ring-accent bg-white

navigation.wrapper: sticky top-0 z-50 w-full border-b border-slate-200 bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-xl

universal_guidelines: Do not use generic gradients. Use solid colors or subtle noise textures.
Ensure all interactive elements have a hover state.
All interactive elements MUST include data-testid attributes.
Do not use 'Inter' for headings. Use 'Manrope'.
Use 2-3x more spacing than typical designs.
Do not use transparent backgrounds for dropdowns or overlays.
instructions_to_main_agent: Follow the layout strategies strictly. For the marketing site, use the 'Bento Grid' approach. For the dashboard, use the 'High Density' approach. Use the provided image URLs for their respective categories. Do not invent new colors; stick to the defined palette.
